intro: Echioides bungei, commonly known as the Bunge's echium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
